poem:
**Coronation in February**

In the cold,  
a quiet salutation,  
cauliflower crowns  
the table—  
comfort in the curve  
of egg and bowl,  
where warmth lingers  
in whispered steam.  
Invite here  
the dear and living—  
in solemn assembly  
of kind familiarity,  
let love be served  
in simple grace.  
A feast to embrace  
both season and soul.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Georgina Hayden’s coronation cauliflower and egg salad – recipe Historically, February is the month when I really embrace the joy of staying in. I want to see friends and family, but I’m also not too fussed about leaving the house. It’s too cold to be checking train times and organising diaries – come to mine and we can curl up in the warm. It’s also the time of year when I most crave comfort and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
